title: Potting up Tomato Seedlings! ALL 540 of Them!

subtasks: Ensure potting soil is adequately moist before transplanting
Fill the next-sized tray with moist soil, tapping to settle
Carefully remove seedlings from the original tray by pinching base and gently prying
Sort seedlings by variety, laying them out on the new tray to prevent mixing
Make holes in each new cell with fingers or a tool
Place roots into the holes, burying up to the first set of true leaves
Fill cells around roots with moist soil, avoiding compacting
Water each tray thoroughly to settle soil and reduce transplant shock
Monitor for proper hydration and root establishment before hardening off
Keep transplanted seedlings in the same conditions for 2-3 days after potting
Monitor moisture levels, avoiding overwatering to prevent fungus
Gradually acclimate tomatoes to outdoor conditions over a week to ten days
Check for frost protection and delay planting if necessary until safe dates.
